Dead by Daylight is the perfect example of why i dont play online games and thanks to that miserable 52 hour experience i will honor that forever. Its pretty much the most decisive online game i have ever played with one of the most toxic communities ever juuuust a tiny bit behind League of Legends or COD. The devs dont give a single shit about the balancing and the major problems this game has and dont listen to anything the community tells them about it. Allowing people to play with their friends on PUBLIC MATCHES using comms such as Discord COMPLETELY throws the game balance out the window making it 100 % impossible for the average or even the expert killer to do anything but hope for RNG or arrogant mistakes or play specific killers that can camp well yet the devs dont care cause MONEY and pandering to toxic bullies. The matchmaking has been reworked and its utter dogshit making it impossible to have a nice fun experience cause with every 2 ''wins'' you get stuck in a high matchmaking range making you play against sweaty 4 man groups with comms that like to bully people and try to win at all costs. The only way to lower it (and its soo slow to actually lower) is to consistently lose to them SUCH FUN. Unfortunately all of this wont ever be fixed cause the majority of the community is survivor sided and only care about their wins and fun (bullying inexperienced people) and devs care about the sweet money and exposure the 4 man groups and toxic TTVS give them. Another major problem is the bloodpoint system which is GRINDY AS SHIT forcing you to play THOUSANDS OF HOURS if you want to level up a good chunk of survs and killers (which is mandatory if you want to actually last 2 mins in the match) since the points each match gives you is an incredibly small sum for the sheer content this game has. In conclusion if you want to play 3 casual matches a week then give this a go but if you want something more especially on the killer side of things AVOID AT ALL COSTS PLAY SOMETHING BETTER

Good game

I've played this game almost 90 hours now and the game has become worse than ever.
If you wanna play with your friends as Survivors DON'T BUY IT.
The killers are OP and survivors almost have no chance for escaping.
No mechanic to prevent campers. No chance for running if the killer saw you. You always leave scratch marks and the killer almost always know where you're going.
If you wanna play the killer, have fun the game is for you.

P.S. The devs will always keep on bringing new OP killers.

Antes era divertido, las partidas super chill para pasarla bien ahora tanto de survi como de killer cada partida se transformaron en aburrimiento total, de survi te empareja o con gente que abandona, gente que no hace literalmente nada durante toda la partida. Como los asesinos cada vez tiene mas desventajas reparas todos los motores en 5 minutos y listo no hay punto medio de equilibrio entre las facultades del survi y del killer. Si jugas de Killer o te tocan todos survis que no hacen absolutamente nada, los colgas a todos o alguno abandona la partida o todos survis que rushean generadores y la partida se termina en 5 minutos, 5 minutos en los que corriste a todos los survis y lograste colgar a uno una sola vez y ahi se termino todo. No hay equilibrio alguno entre ambos "bandos" el juego se transformó en un absoluto aburrimiento, durante el tiempo que lo jugue compre dlcs desbloque perks pero con los últimos cambios e incorporaciones de personajes se transformo en una porquería. Una decepción.

Decent game

TL:DR= Game's no longer fun, at least on a mid to high level.

SURVIVOR'S POV
More and more killers are resorting to camping/tunneling/slugging because the gameplay rewards you and encourages you to implement this strategy. While this may be effective to achieve victory, it is no fun for the people that are forced to endure it. People seem to have long forgotten why we are here playing videogames: to have fun, not to sweat like our life depended on it. I don't even mind facing the same 3 killers all the time, I don't even care if 9/10 players are abusing the most broken thing they can find on the current version of the game, the real problem is literally the impossibility of having fun.

KILLER'S POV
On the other hand you have killer gameplay! So, from what I've said, you should be the one in control of the gameplay? Right? Nope, that's because the better you get, the worse your experience in Dead By Daylight is gonna become. Let me explain. Becoming better usually means winning more games, which implies your 'rank' goes up (ranking in this game is MMR based, so it's based on an hidden value), which results in you being matched with more experienced players. As your rank gets higher, you will notice an overall worsening of your experience. Essentially playing anything that is non-meta is going to result in you getting absolutely demolished. More and more SWF (Survive With Friends) death squadrons are gonna make their triumphant appearence in your lobbies. Generators (which are the main survivor's objective) are gonna get done in approximately 5 minutes, which means that your average game will last < 10 minutes (yeah, this is actually a bad thing as you won't have physical time to get your objective done). Players' toxicity will drastically increase alongside with your 'rank'. And I could go on, but it would only make this even more boring. Well, let's not delve into 'details' so much, what I'm trying to say is that getting better is going to result in you not having fun, kind of a contradiction for a videogame.

In conclusion, play something else, don't bother purchasing something that's supposed to be a videogame but ends up being a burden.

Update 1/6/22: It seems that the devs finally got the note and are slowly but surely improving quality of life. Still, this game requires much more work for me to recommend again - especially polishing the rough edges instead of pushing more content - but it's slowly getting back on track.


Original review:
Developers have pretty much abandoned any sense of making the game fair and balanced. Only killer strat viable at this point is just camping / tunneling and/or playing a meta killer like Nurse or Blight. Pallets slowing down the game spawn every few feet on some maps whilst on other's they're more scarce than a cure for cancer. And don't get me started on how broken boon totems are.

I'll keep playing and monitoring this game, but as of right now the only way to have fun is to not have fun, and/or to play with friends.

After playing this game on multiple platforms I would not recommend this game as there is a very toxic culture among the player base. Mostly I find it is the survivors who are the culprits for this toxic culture. If you don't play perfectly they bully and belittle you after the match. If you are playing killer or as I call it 'bully simulator' be prepared to be bullied as there is an endless supply of that from the entitled survivor mains. This is especially true if you are up against a survive with friends team. I used to enjoy this game when it first came out on the PS4. I sunk a lot of hours into it, but the culture of the current lot of players comprises of some of the most toxic the world has to offer.

If you enjoy community complaints and recommendations for a game to a developer go unheard and no explanation given than look no further! You have found the game that you can dump hundreds of hours into but not really start to enjoy until you are at a minimum 350 hours deep in! If you want to grind for dozens if not hundreds of hours just to feel like the in game currency, (that being blood points or BP for short) is laughably under given and to feel like you will never obtain the perks or consumables that you desire, then this will give you the final motivation to video game yourself! Don't even wait for this baby to go on sale.

But all jokes aside this game has the potential to be consistently enjoyable and fun. This game does have it's moments but the bad out ways the good. My biggest complaints is how they handle the blood web and perk unlocks. It takes waaaaay too long to get perks that you want and don't even get me started on getting your preferred perks for killers. You will dump millions and millions of blood points equating to hundreds and hundreds if not potentially a thousand or more hours to get all the perks for every killer and survivor in game. It's far to grindy and not rewarding enough.
